sub_title: Hospitality Sales Specialist- focus on group and corporate markets

profile_positions.description: Focus on the Corporate and MICE market.
profile_positions.title: Associate Director of Sales- Corporate/MICE

profile_positions.description:
	Manage Meeting Incentive Conference Exhibitions (MICE) sales for five (5) Park Plaza hotels *four star and (1) art’otel *five star in the region of the Holland, Netherlands- focus on greater Amsterdam area to include airport location 
	Effectively manage existing MICE agencies to include major TMC’s such as American Express, Carlson Wagonlit Travel (CWT), Helmesbrisco and local DMC accounts within the Amsterdam city
	Undertake sales calls and presentations to develop and grow relationships and maximize revenue from agency and local companies booking into the Amsterdam and greater Netherlands region
	Prospect and develop target lists of new potential accounts by defined industry segment and undertake tele-sales and other prospecting activity to realize potential revenue 
	Attend sales trips and sales blitzes within region and attend major tradeshows to include IMEX -Frankfurt, Confex-London, Meetingshow- London, M&I Forums-Paris
	Coordinate, conduct and entertain site inspections and familiarization (FAM) trips to show case multiple properties 
	Produce and execute action plan in MICE market segment. Reporting and organizing activity goals weekly
	Work with the meeting and events team to set-up a communication to proactively follow up with clients who have used facilities in the past to generate bookings
	Assist meeting and events and group reservation departments in converting high revenue potential bookings 
	Create and ensure timely communication of promotions to the market place based on the market and dairy needs
	Evaluate the online tools with marketing, to include Cvent, property site(s), third party site(s) to track return on investment, advise of new sites within the market 
	Cross-sell thirty eight (38) PPHE properties within major European cities to include: United Kingdom (UK), Croatia and Germany
profile_positions.title: Sales Manager - MICE

profile_positions.description:
➢	Group sales manager at Starwood hotels flagship hotel, with 1,780 guest rooms and 60,000 Sq feet of meeting space; responsible for booking mid- size groups
➢	Solicit group business that enables the hotel to exceed revenue in rooms and food and beverage; focus on the corporate market
➢	Prepare correspondence to customers, internal booking reports and file maintenance
➢	Participate in daily RevMax meetings, sales calls and site inspections
➢	Attend trade shows, industry meetings to enhance one’s knowledge with exposure 
➢	Work with other operational departments of the hotel to provide quality service to customers
➢	Co-Champion of the sustainability committee, key focus on initiatives to enhance the hotel’s commitment to compliance in making a smaller footprint in the environment
profile_positions.title: Group Sales Manager

profile_positions.description:
➢	Managed 7 of the top 17 corporate accounts globally to endorse over 1000 Starwood properties with a 9.5 million goal for 2013, accounts to include- Coke Cola, IBM, J.P. Morgan Chase, Citi Bank, KPMG, ESPN and Accenture
➢	Consult clients on appropriate properties to place meetings and events globally
➢	Create and offer bundle options and client incentives to place meetings at our properties worldwide
➢	Track client spend, create and conduct business reviews of market share
➢	Coordinate and facilitate client events at hotels for customer awareness 
➢	Manage and consult hotel offers to client and review contracts and Master Service Agreements
➢	Organize and compile commission payments to third parties to ensure client satisfaction
profile_positions.title: Sales Specialist

profile_positions.description:
	Provide support for three Account Directors with their accounts in the Pharmaceutical and Travel management market segment.
	Responsible for the processing and booking of group business, focusing on large sized pharmaceutical meetings globally.  Ensure hotels comply with Master Service Agreements (MSA) and concessions when submitting proposals into Stracite/Cvent.  Recap daily availability reports to meeting planners as well as work closely in placing meeting at appropriate sized properties.
	Manage the sales process for group RFP process from start to finish: receiving the initial lead or email; gathering bids and following up with properties; and logging all account activity in ISAC (internal system).
	Coordinate and lead Starwood Days agency visits for NAD (North America Division).  Assign visit dates and prepare participating hotels with vital information in order to have a successful visit. 
	Compile and format data for monthly/quarterly reports of production for client.  
	Request updates from planners and communicate meeting specs needed or hold space placement to hotels.  Ensure all Statement of Work (SOW) are completed and filed in ISAC and turned definite.
	Supported Tier II managers in the 117 accounts for their 2012 Transent RFP process.  To include launching and tracking bid responses in timeley maner.  Asuring hotel response to the client on the due date, auting rates and value adds.  Renegotaiting rates, submitting and uploading bids to clients.  Manually complied year over year reports for managers.
profile_positions.title: Sales Coordinator
